Lists System Information for the Current Machine

Source: R/system_info.R
system_info.Rd

Lists System Information for the Current Machine

system_info()

Value

A named list with elements hostname (a character string), os_info, cpu_info, and disk_free (data frames/tibbles).

Details

This function reads/queries base::Sys.info(), disk_free(), and cpu_info() on the current machine.

Examples

info <- system_info()
#> Warning: The following named parsers don't match the column names: Mounted on
#> Warning: 52 parsing failures.
#> row col  expected    actual         file
#>   1  -- 7 columns 6 columns <connection>
#>   2  -- 7 columns 6 columns <connection>
#>   3  -- 7 columns 6 columns <connection>
#>   4  -- 7 columns 6 columns <connection>
#>   5  -- 7 columns 6 columns <connection>
#> ... ... ......... ......... ............
#> See problems(...) for more details.
print(info)
#> $hostname
#> [1] "hb-x1"
#> 
#> $os_info
#> # A tibble: 5 × 2
#>   field   value                                       
#>   <chr>   <chr>                                       
#> 1 sysname Linux                                       
#> 2 release 5.4.0-107-generic                           
#> 3 version #121-Ubuntu SMP Thu Mar 24 16:04:27 UTC 2022
#> 4 machine x86_64                                      
#> 5 os_type unix                                        
#> 
#> $cpu_info
#> # A tibble: 58 × 2
#>    field      value                                   
#>    <chr>      <chr>                                   
#>  1 hostname   hb-x1                                   
#>  2 processor  0                                       
#>  3 vendor_id  vendor_GenuineIntel                     
#>  4 cpu_family 6                                       
#>  5 model      142                                     
#>  6 model_name Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-8650U CPU @ 1.90GHz
#>  7 stepping   10                                      
#>  8 microcode  0xea

#> 10 cache_size 8192 KB                                 
#> # … with 48 more rows
